#text=When I go grocery shopping I almost always take a list .
#text=So for me , the first step to shopping is list making .
#text=I list what I plan to cook this week , and also cleaning products and similar things .
#text=My favorite place to shop is a huge membership store , for its good prices .
#text=I pick up a shopping cart just outside the store .
#text=Then I enter , sometimes showing my membership card to the person at the door and sometimes getting in without showing it .
#text=I cruise past the impulse items just inside the door , and through the electronics and organic foods sections that come next .
#text=Next come many aisles with items like light bulbs and pillows .
#text=There are usually people here offering samples of new food items .
#text=I buy large packages of chicken or fish that can be frozen .
#text=I continue to the fresh fruit and vegetable section , where I try to restrain myself to what I can use .
#text=Next come the chiller and frozen foods , but I go past hem to pet food and paper goods .
#text=I get frozen food on the way back , and then a few canned food and dry goods .
#text=The last areas are pharmacy , which I mostly avoid , and the book section , where I 'm apt to linger .
#text=Then I wait in line for a while , pay , and leave the store .
#text=As I leave , someone checks my cart , to make sure what 's on my receipt matches the huge load I am carting home .
